dt: {bc}a usually circular line encompassing an area
{bc}the space enclosed within such a line

dt.t: the periodic {wi}circuit{/wi} of the Earth around the Sun
The damaged bridge forced him to take a long {wi}circuit{/wi} to his destination.

dt: {bc}a regular tour (as by a traveling judge or preacher) around an assigned district or territory

dt.t: The preacher ministered to each congregation in his {wi}circuit{/wi}.
His {wi}circuit{/wi} took him to many towns in the county.

dt: {bc}a group of church congregations ministered to by one pastor
{bc}the complete path of an electric current including usually the source of electric energy
{bc}a two-way communication path between points (as in a computer)
{bc}a neuronal pathway of the brain along which electrical and chemical signals travel
{bc}a number or series of public outlets (such as theaters, radio shows, or arenas) offering the same kind of presentation

dt.t: He loved competing on the rodeo {wi}circuit{/wi}.
She rose through the theater {wi}circuit{/wi} to become a big-time entertainer.

et: Middle English, from Middle French & Latin; Middle French {it}circuite{/it}, from Latin {it}circuitus{/it}, from {it}circumire, circuire{/it} to go around, from {it}circum-{/it} + {it}ire{/it} to go {ma}{mat|issue:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a usually circular line encompassing an area
the space enclosed within such a line

dt.t: a route that {wi}circuits{/wi} the Back Bay section of the city

dt: {bc}a switch that automatically interrupts the current of an overloaded electric circuit

shortdef: a switch that automatically interrupts the current of an overloaded electric circuit

dt: {bc}a court that sits at two or more places within one judicial district

shortdef: a court that sits at two or more places within one judicial district

dt: {bc}a judge who holds a circuit court

shortdef: a judge who holds a circuit court

dt: {bc}a clergyman assigned to a circuit especially in a rural area

shortdef: a clergyman assigned to a circuit especially in a rural area

dt: {bc}any {d_link|integrated circuit|integrated circuit} designed to perform a single, specific task

dt.t: An {wi}application-specific integrated circuit{/wi} (ASIC) … enables wireless telemetry, remote powering …

shortdef: any integrated circuit designed to perform a single, specific task —abbreviation ASIC

dt: {bc}the theaters and nightclubs associated with the Jewish summer resorts in the Catskills

et: from the popularity of borscht on menus of the resorts
shortdef: the theaters and nightclubs associated with the Jewish summer resorts in the Catskills

dt: {bc}used in, shown on, or being a television installation in which the signal is transmitted by wire to a limited number of receivers

shortdef: used in, shown on, or being a television installation in which the signal is transmitted by wire to a limited number of receivers
